page.title: 14Secondary Education
page.content: The two{secondary}schools in the area cater for only a few of the village children.{St. Augustine's R.C. {High}takes R.C. pupils from most of the{Ribble Valley}and the towns of Padiham,Gt.Harwood and Rishton.It is an 11-16{comprehensive}with 7 forms of entry - a total of some 900 pupils. {Oak Hill,}a small{private}school, draws its pupils from the whole of Lancashire. The majority of pupils transferring at 11 take a selection test{(11+)}to assess suitability for the{Grammar} school in Clitheroe,some 6 miles away.Pupils of a non-academic nature are offered places at Ribblesdale {Secondary Modern}(Clitheroe). An alternative choice for{C.E.pupils would be the Schools of St.Wilfrid's C.E.(Blackburn) and St. Christopher's C.E.(Accrington) - both comprehensive.
